CVE.summary: Race condition in libssl in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.15.4, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 27.0, Firefox ESR 24.x before 24.3, Thunderbird before 24.3, SeaMonkey before 2.24, and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors involving a resumption handshake that triggers incorrect replacement of a session ticket.

vFeed.Product: vFeed - The Correlated Vulnerability and Threat Database
vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

RHSA-2014:0917: nss and nspr security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Critical)
ELSA-2014-0917 -- nss and nspr security, bug fix, and enhancement update (critical)

Race condition in libssl in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.15.4, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 27.0, Firefox ESR 24.x before 24.3, Thunderbird before 24.3, SeaMonkey before 2.24, and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors involving a resumption handshake that triggers incorrect replacement of a session ticket

Redhat.title: RHSA-2014:1047: nss nad nspr bug fix and enhancement update (Moderate)

bugzilla.title: Suboptimal shell code in nss.spec
CVE-2013-1740 nss: false start PR_Recv information disclosure security issue
CVE-2014-1490 nss: TOCTOU, potential use-after-free in libssl's session ticket processing (MFSA 2014-12)
CVE-2014-1491 nss: Do not allow p-1 as a public DH value (MFSA 2014-12)
CVE-2014-1492 nss: IDNA hostname matching code does not follow RFC 6125 recommendation (MFSA 2014-45)
CVE-2014-1545 Mozilla: Out of bounds write in NSPR (MFSA 2014-55)
Rebase nspr in RHEL 5.11 to NSPR 4.10.6 (required for FF31)
Rebase nss in RHEL 5.11 to NSS 3.16.1 (required for FF 31)
